com.jakubkaleta.checklist.DataAccess.services
Class DataAccessService

java.lang.Object
  com.jakubkaleta.checklist.DataAccess.services.DataAccessService

public class DataAccessService
extends Object

Contains methods that abstract certain aspects of data access and can be called from multiple activities.

Author:
Jakub Kaleta

public int getSelectedItemsCount()
Returns:
The total number of selected items in all categories

updateUserDefinedSort

public void updateUserDefinedSort(int activityId,
                                  int categoryId,
                                  int oldPosition,
                                  int newPosition)
Updates the user defined sort order in the database to match the new user defined sort order.

Parameters:
activityId - ID of the activity that contains all the categories to be updated
categoryId - ID of the category for which the sort order was updated
oldPosition - The old sort position - 0 based
newPosition - The new sort position - 0 based

getActivitiesWithChildren

public ActivitiesDataSource getActivitiesWithChildren(Long[] idsOfActivitiesToGet,
                                                      Boolean includeEmptyLists)
Retrieves all existing Activity names and ids from the database

Parameters:
idsOfActivitiesToGet - An array of ids of activities that are supposed to be retrieved with children from the database. May be empty. If it is empty, then this method retrieves all activities.
includeEmptyLists - If this parameter is set to true, the method also retrieves empty lists
Returns:
A new ActivitiesDataSource - complete data source from the database.

insertNewItems

public void insertNewItems(List<ActivityBean> newItems)
Inserts the new activities with children, to the database

Parameters:
newItems - The new items to insert

checkActivityNameAvailability

public Boolean checkActivityNameAvailability(String activityName,
                                             long activityId)
Checks if the passed in activity name is available

Parameters:
activityName - The activity name to check
activityId - Optionally, the id of the activity to exclude from the search 0 by default.
Returns:
True if name is available, false if it is taken

copyList

public Boolean copyList(long idOfTheListToCopy,
                        String newListName)
Copies the list with the given id into a new list, with the given name.

Parameters:
idOfTheListToCopy - The id of the list to be copied
newListName - The name to give to the new list
Returns:
True if copied successfully, false if failed.
